text: Donald James Grimes (born 4 October 1937) is an Australian politician, diplomat and doctor. He is a member of the Labor Party. He was a Senator for Tasmania from 1974 to 1987. He served as a minister in the Hawke Government as Minister for Social Security (1983–1984) and Minister for Community Services (1984–1987). He also served as Australian Ambassador to the Netherlands from 1987 to 1991. Grimes was born in Albury, New South Wales. He married Margaret Schofield in 1960. The couple had four children. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Ambassadors of Australia Category:Australian Labor Party politicians Category:Australian medical doctors Category:Government ministers of Australia Category:Members of the Australian Senate Category:Politicians from New South Wales Category:Politicians from Tasmania Category:Order of Australia
title: Don Grimes
